title: A fun adventure, but not as good as the previous movie
review:
Great things about the movies:
1) The mystery/clue solving and action scenes are interesting.
2) Good performances by Nicolas Cage as Benjamin Franklin Gates, Diane Kruger as Dr. Abigail Chase, Justin Bartha as Riley Poole, Jon Voight as Patrick Henry Gates, Helen Mirren as Dr. Emily Appleton-Gates, and Ed Harris as Mitch Wilkinson.
3) The production design and visual effects are well done.Weaknesses of the movie:
1) Some concepts are similar to the previous movie: another treasure hunter with his violent men, the protagonists become hostages, the FBI fails to catch them.
2) The main characters are extremely lucky.Debatable holes:
1) Ben ridiculously knew everything at the perfect time.
2) Riley could hack everything, even the Buckingham Palace and the White House.
3) When there was the chasing in London, the police did not do anything.
4) Abigail luckily was in a relationship with someone important from the White House. That person was also luckily easy to engineer.
5) They were able to infiltrate the White House that did not have proper security.
6) Connor believed that Abigail's earring was lost in the Oval Office.
7) Connor should have heard the sound of Ben doing something with the desk.
8) The president agreed to discover the secret tunnel during a party with only few guards.
9) The security during the president's birthday party was weak.
10) How did Ben know about the secret tunnel at Mount Vernon?
11) The event organizer could not find any places other than Mount Vernon. They should have prepared long time ago with backup plan. They could also have special access for venue.
12) It was very lucky that the president was about to have a party at the time Ben needed to meet the president.
13) It was so convenient that the president was very kind to Ben.
14) Why did Mitch decide to save others?
15) Mitch himself should have not been able to open the door tot he tunnel.

title: Better than its predecessor
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) Amazing storytelling and adaptation of the brilliant novel by Dan Brow. It is an improvement over the previous movie.
2) Great performances by Tom Hanks as Robert Langdon, Ewan McGregor as Father Patrick McKenna, Ayelet Zurer as Dr. Vittoria Vetra, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd as Commander Maximilian Richter, Pierfrancesco Favino as Inspector General Ernesto Olivetti, Nikolaj Lie Kaas as The Assassin, and Armin Mueller-Stahl as Cardinal Strauss.
3) The production design and music are perfect.
4) The character introductions and roles are well done.
5) The mysteries, clues, and references are very interesting.

movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
title: A fun pirate adventure movie, but not as good as its previous installments
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The story is interesting.
2) The world-building is well-done.
3) The production design, costumes, make-up and properties are fascinating.
4) The movie score beautiful.
5) Johnny Depp as Jack Sparrow and Geoffrey Rush as Hector Barbossa are perfect.
6) Great performances by Ian McShane as Blackbeard, Penélope Cruz as Angelica, Kevin McNally as Joshamee Gibbs, Sam Claflin as Philip Swift, Àstrid Bergès-Frisbey as Syrena, and Richard Griffiths as King George II.
7) A fun adventure and hilarious movie.
8) The special effects and visual effects are superb.
9) The action scenes excellent.Debatable holes:
1) The Royal Navy soldiers could not fight properly. They always lost and never used their guns.
2) Jack easily stole the chalices from the Spanish Navy. There were no guards at their camp.
3) Why were Jack and Barbossa loosely tied near each other? No one was guarding them and no one was pattolling.
4) Why did Syrena help Jack by giving the chalices?
5) The main characters never had an injury from any fights.
6) How could the Santiago stay balanced when only Barbossa entered the ship?

title: The amount of destruction is perfect. It is better than the 2003 version
review: It is perfectly synchronized with the 2003 version, this movie somehow continues what the 2003 version started. Good music, production set, design, action scenes, and props. Some visual effects are great, but some Hulk's effects and green screen scenes need improvement. It has the same feeling with the 2003 version, the military, gamma radiation and anger, Betty and her father, chasing and destruction, but this time, it has equal opponent and more smash. Good casting and performances from Edward Norton as Bruce Banner, Liv Tyler as Betty Ross, and Tim Roth as Emil Blonsky/Abomination. Great casting and good performance from William Hurt as Thaddeus 'Thunderbolt' Ross. General Ross and Betty did not do anything significant at the end of the movie. The fight with Emil feels incomplete and the fate of Emil is not clear. The relationship between Bruce and Betty is well-done. It is quite boring in the middle.

movie_title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
title: The movie could have been shorter
review:
An interesting novel story. The visual effects and special effects are okay. The music and costumes are perfect for the movie. Isle Esme is amazing. The wedding scene is gorgeous. The actors and actresses did okay job.Debatable holes:
1) How could Alice's power work on Bella?
2) After the baby was born, Bella should have been in agony, she should have not even be conscious.
3) How could the Cullens control themselves when Bella was drinking blood? How could they even possibly control themselves when the baby was being born?
4) Edward's clothes were covered in blood when the wolves came, how could Jasper and others control themselves?
5) No one was hurt after the fight between the Cullens and the wolves. Were they hesitate?

title: A good movie, but it could not anticipate the hype after the Avengers
review: The writing is good, it has cool moments, surprising elements, and quite disappointing parts. It is a good follow-up of the Avengers, and once again the Iron Man starts another phase. It is clear that Tony is heavily impacted by the New York event, because he was the one who closely finished the battle. It is understandable why Tony has so many enemies from the way he treats and acts disrespectfully towards people. We see Tony being vulnerable, threatened, and anxious, but we also see that he is a genius and resourceful inventor. His relationships with Pepper, Happy, and Rhodes are strengthened through the conflicts that personally impact them. The inclusions of the President, the Vice President, and Harley Keener are not desirable, but Tony's relation with Harley is well-done. The Mandarin twist is very clever, although many people dislike it very much. The character growth, villains, and humor are well-done.The casting and performances are good: Robert Downey Jr. as Tony Stark/Iron Man, Gwyneth Paltrow as Virginia Pepper Potts, Don Cheadle as James 'Rhodey Rhodes/Iron Patriot, Guy Pearce as Aldrich Killian, Ty Simpkins as Harley Keener, Jon Favreau as Happy Hogan, Ben Kingsley as Trevor Slattery, and Paul Bettany as JARVIS.The production set, costumes, make-up, visual and special effects, props, tone, action sequences, and music are well-done.

title: It is nice to see the MCU starts growing
review: Good writing, music, production set, props, visual and special effects, costumes. The action scenes are cool, especially the fight between Iron Man, War Machine, and the Hammer drones. Natasha's fight choreography is cool, but it is not believable that they were easily defeated. Good casting and performances from Robert Downey Jr. as Tony Stark/Iron Man, Gwyneth Paltrow as Pepper Potts, Don Cheadle as James 'Rhodey' Rhodes/War Machine, Scarlett Johansson as Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow, Sam Rockwell as Justin Hammer, Mickey Rourke as Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, Samuel L. Jackson as Nick Fury, Jon Favreau as Happy Hogan, and Clark Gregg as Phil Coulson. The way they connect the movies in the MCU like the post-credit scene is so brilliant. Tony's friendship with Rhodey and relationship with Pepper are well-done. Robert successfully portray Tony as a genius, inventor, and technologist.

movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
title: The 'Infinity War' of Pirates of the Caribbean series
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The story is fantastic.
2. The world-building is perfect.
3. The production design, costumes, make-up and properties are magnificent.
4. One of the best and my favorite scores ever.
5. Johnny Depp as Jack Sparrow and Bill Nighy as Davy Jones are perfect.
6. Great performances by Orlando Bloom as Will Turner, Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Swann, Jack Davenport as James Norrington, Tom Hollander as Lord Cutler Beckett, Stellan Skarsgård as 'Bootstrap Bill' Turner, Kevin McNally as Joshamee Gibbs, Lee Arenberg as Pintel, Mackenzie Crook as Ragetti, and Naomie Harris as Tia Dalma.
7. A fun, hilarious and thrilling adventure.
8. Gore Verbinski did amazing job.
9. The special effects and visual effects are awesome, especially the Kraken and Davy Jones.
10. The action scenes are super.Debatable holes:
1. Will was so lucky to find someone who was willing to take him to the Black Pearl. He was also so lucky to find someone who had found the Black Pearl.
2. How could Pintel and Ragetti set sail on a small boat? How could they luckily find the Black Pearl?
3. After the Kraken attacked the Black Pearl, all the main crew and only them survived.
4. How could Davy Jones not find Will when he was running away? He was floating on the sea and hiding on Jones' ship.
5. How could Norrington safely arrive at Port Royal?
6. Davy Jones could just defeat Jack and his crew easily by teleporting to the Black Pearl once again.

movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
title: Johnny Depp is truly Captain Jack Sparrow and this is a great story about pirates.
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The story is awesome.
2) The world-building is perfect.
3) The production design, costumes and properties are magnificent.
4) One of the best and my favorite scores ever.
5) Johnny Depp as Jack Sparrow is perfect.
6) Great performances by Geoffrey Rush as Barbossa, Orlando Bloom as Will Turner, Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Swann, Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Swann, Jonathan Pryce as Governor Weatherby Swann, Kevin R. McNally as Joshamee Gibbs, Lee Arenberg as Pintel, and Mackenzie Crook as Ragetti.
7) A fun and thrilling adventure.
8) Gore Verbinski did amazing job.
9) The special effects are successful, the visual effects are also great, but could be improved for the skeletons.Debatable holes:
1) When Jack and Will were trying to commandeer HMS Interceptor, they used a boat underwater. How could there be air void?
2) When Barbossa attacked HMS Interceptor from the Black Pearl, the main characters were luckily unharmed, although they were greatly outnumbered and not perfectly armed.
3) The Royal Navy officers were too innocent, unskilled, and passive.
4) When Barbossa's crew attacked the Dauntless, how could there still be many Royal Navy officers left? They were fighting violent immortal pirates.
5) Isla de Muerta was easily found.
6) The smoke signal made by Elizabeth was easily and quickly discovered by the Royal Navy.

movie_title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
title: Truly fantastical, a wonderful introduction to Narnia
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. Beautiful introduction to Narnia, the story is interesting.
2. The practical effects and make-up for centaurs, minotaurs, fauns and dwarfs are realistic and detailed.
3. The production design and locations are perfect.
4. The scenes where Narnians fight Jadis' army (third act) are epic.
5. Pevensies' armor and Jadis' 3 costumes (white ice, black sacrifice, hunting armor) are very cool.
6. Perfect cast, good acting and voice acting: William Moseley as Peter Pevensie, Skandar Keynes as Edmund Pevensie, Georgie Henley as Lucy Pevensie, James McAvoy as Mr. Tumnus, Ray Winstone as the voice of Mr. Beaver, and Dawn French as the voice of Mrs. Beaver.
7. Liam Neeson as Aslan is perfect; Tilda Swinton is unforgettable as the cold witch.
8. Great lessons: sincere sacrifice; completing, helping and believing in each other as family; loyalty and hope.
9. Beautiful score and music.The animations for beavers, wolves, fox, griffins and giants need to be improved.Debatable holes:
1. When the wolves were looking for the Pevensies and interrogating the fox, they should have been able to discover them from their smell, because they were just a few metres above.
2. The other wolves should have been able to attack Peter and friends from behind during the waterfall scene. Maugrim was not brave nor confident enough to attack Peter (twice), although he was the Captain of Jadis' police force and Peter barely knew how to hold a sword.
3. When Aslan was going to sacrifice himself, there should have been guards around his camp.
4. The time for Aslan's additional army to go from Jadis' castle to the battlefield was too short, considering that it was pretty far.
5. In the final battle scene, Oreius was frozen by White Witch and broken into pieces. However, during coronation scene, he could be seen.

movie_title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
title: Great movie, the ending needs improvement
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The action scenes are amazing.
2. The visual effects when the dagger is used are excellent.
3. The acting is good, from the main and supporting characters to the villains. Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton, Ben Kingsley, and Alfred Molina do good job.
4. The production design is well-made.
5. Costumes and properties are visually interesting.
6. The music makes the action scenes and adventure even better.The resolution does not fit perfectly. The animations for the Hassansins, the snake, and some landscape scenes are not smooth. The main characters are mostly whitewashed, unfortunately.Debatable holes:
1. Dastan and Tamina were very lucky, they were barely injured.
2. If Alamut's defense was known to be very formidable for years, than it should have not been breached that easily.
3. The Dastan, Nizam, Tus, Garsiv , and Tamina did not have guardians at all, although they were princes and princess.
4. People who could actually fight are only the main characters.
5. Sheik Amar and Seso changed their heart too easily to help Dastan and Tamina.
6. Hassansins were known to be fierce warriors, but they could not even defeat Sheik Amar and Garsiv's people.
7. It was unclear why time rewound to the moment Dastan found the dagger.
8. Dastan was a superhuman, he was so durable, strong, fast, lucky, healthy, fit, and had high stamina, power and energy.
9. How could the snake swallow the dagger?
10. The enemies did not kill the protagonists whenever they could and they were easily distracted.
11. The characters easily found each other with little effort, whether it was in a crowded village, a vast dessert, or any locations.
12. Tus and Garsiv easily believed in Dastan at the end of the movie.
13. Dastan and Tamina could escape easily on the day King Sharaman died.

title: Spider-man really had hard times
review: The movie successfully show the struggle of being a superhero, especially in the shoes of Peter Parker, who has so many things to take care. His clash with Doctor Octopus is one of the best hero-villain clashes. The action scenes are terrific, because Spider-man and Doctor Octopus' fighting styles are unique. Their battles are awesome, especially on the train.Mary Jane Watson is a selfish gold digger who puts Spider-man in danger (due to her relationship with Peter) and breaks Peter & Harry's friendship. She decided to be with Flash to get the privileges from the relationship, such as being protected by the school bully himself; she decided to be with Harry to enjoy his wealth; she was interested to Spider-man because he saved her life; she was interested to Peter because he was her only friend; she decided to be with John Jameson because he is a famous, successful, kind and brave astronaut; she hugged and kissed John when she was actually thinking about Peter; she decided to marry him although she did not want to; and she left John a few seconds before the wedding ceremony started, then she went straight to Peter's place in wedding gown, kissed him and told him she loved him.The great: Story, plot, action scenes, character & emotional development, production design, music, visual effects (except the sun), villain; casting and performances of Tobey Maguire as Peter Parker/Spider-Man, Alfred Molina as Otto Octavius/Doctor Octopus, Rosemary Harris as May Parker, and J. K. Simmons reprises his role as J. Jonah Jameson.The good: Costume; casting and performances of the other characters, especially Kirsten Dunst as Mary Jane Watson and James Franco as Harry Osborn.

title: How vampires + action should be, although the villains must learn how to fight.
review:
Perfect casting: Wesley Snipes as Blade, N'Bushe Wright as Dr. Karen Jenson, Stephen Dorff as Deacon Frost, and Kris Kristofferson as Abraham Whistler did amazing job. The action scenes, properties, and music are awesome. It is very cool to see Blade does the fight using his gadgets and guns.The visual effects are so weird. Some special effects are too much. The vampires could not keep up with Blade's strength and skill. Violence, gore, pain, torture, blood, and scars are abundant in this movie, which make it less enjoyable. But perhaps people would say 'what do you expect? It is an R-rated vampire movie; not just a vampire, it is Blade.'Debatable holes:
1) Blade held a bleeding cop and tried to shoot at him, but the people around did not do or realize anything.
2) Karen did not get hurt, not even a single shot hit her.
3) How did Frost find Blade?
4) When Frost encountered Blade on the street, the people around did not realize or do something.
5) When the girl fell on the street, the bus did not try to stop. No one was affected by what happened.
6) When Blade was around the street, no one even realized or noticed.
7) How did Frost find Blade's place?
8) How could Frost arrive at Blade's place before Blade on the street?
9) After Karen saved herself, she easily took a gun and no one saw her. The enemies did not guard the place properly.
10) Karen easily found, saved, and freed Blade.
11) After being bitten, Karen was able to stand, think, talk, walk, shoot, and fight.
12) How could Blade kill a vampire using a bone?
13) The enemies should have shot Blade using a silver bullet.
14) Frost's men could not even land a single punch/kick or shoot Blade.
15) Injured Karen easily defended herself and killed a fit vampire.
16) Why were the other pure-blood vampires afraid of Frost?

title: Hugh Jackman is perfect as Wolverine
review: Good origin story, plot and villains; cool action scenes and powers; good character and emotional development, music, special effects, props, production design, costumes and make-up; good casting and performances, especially Hugh Jackman as James 'Jimmy' Howlett/Logan/Wolverine, Liev Schreiber as Victor Creed, Danny Huston as William Stryker, Lynn Collins as Kayla Silverfox, Taylor Kitsch as Remy LeBeau/Gambit, Will.i.am as John Wraith, Kevin Durand as Fred Dukes/Blob and Daniel Henney as Agent Zero. The visual effects need improvement, especially Wolverine's power and green screen scenes. Gambit's should have had more screen time and bigger role, more action scenes and power shown, better costume and effects. Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool is controversial but it is okay for the movie.

title: Deep, tragic, beautiful
review: Inspiring and beautiful story. Amazing performances by Robin Williams as John Keating, Ethan Hawke as Todd Anderson, Robert Sean Leonard as Neil Perry, Josh Charles as Knox Overstreet, Gale Hansen as Charlie Dalton, Norman Lloyd as Headmaster Gale Nolan, and Kurtwood Smith as Thomas Perry.

movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
title: The 'Avengers: Endgame' of the series.
review:
1) The story is absolutely fantastic. The complicated plot twist, multilevel conflicts and brilliant resolution are perfect.
2) The world-building is perfect, the world of pirates are real.
3) The production design, costumes, make-up and properties are magnificent. The ships, places, locations, and everything that makes up the world are fascinating.
4) The movie score is irreplacable, Hans Zimmer is the right choice.
5) Johnny Depp as Jack Sparrow, Bill Nighy as Davy Jones, Geoffrey Rush as Hector Barbossa, Orlando Bloom as Will Turner, and Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Swann are perfect.
6) Great performances by Tom Hollander as Cutler Beckett, Kevin R. McNally as Joshamee Gibbs, Jack Davenport as James Norrington, Jonathan Pryce as Weatherby Swann, Lee Arenberg and Mackenzie Crook as Pintel and Ragetti, Stellan Skarsgård as Bootstrap Bill Turner, Chow Yun-fat as Sao Feng, Naomie Harris as Tia Dalma, and Keith Richards as Edward Teague.
7) The adventures are fun, the jokes are hilarious. A thrilling and refreshing experience.
8) A masterpiece from Gore Verbinski.
9) The special effects and visual effects are superb.
10) The action scenes excellent.
11) The best pirates movie I have ever seen so far.

title: It is nice to see the characters, but the writing is not really appealing
review: Good characters, tone, production set, score, music. Great visual and special effects, action scenes, comedy, 4th wall breaking, lines and pop culture references, costumes, prop, make-up, comic adaptation. Perfect casting. The other characters are interesting but not deeply explored. The time travel is tricky. Ryan Reynolds as Wade Wilson/Deadpool, Josh Brolin as Cable, Zazie Beetz as Domino, and Brianna Hildebrand as Negasonic Teenage Warhead are perfectly cast. Their performances are great. Good casting and performances from Morena Baccarin as Vanessa, Julian Dennison as Russell Collins/Firefist, T.J. Miller as Weasel, Leslie Uggams as Blind Al, Karan Soni as Dopinder, and Shiori Kutsuna portrays Yukio. Colossus and juggernaut are perfectly designed and well-performed by Stefan Kapicic. The X-Force and the members are good. The writing is okay, but I do not like the time travelling thing.

title: A promising introduction to the X-Men series that reinvented superhero genre
review: The main characters are perfectly cast and performed, especially Patrick Stewart as Charles Xavier/Professor X, Hugh Jackman as Logan/Wolverine, Ian McKellen as Erik Lehnsherr/Magneto, Halle Berry as Ororo Munroe/Storm, Famke Janssen as Jean Grey, James Marsden as Scott Summers/Cyclops and Rebecca Romijn-Stamos as Raven DarkhÃ¶lme/Mystique. The other characters are well-cast and performed, especially Bruce Davison as Senator Robert Kelly and Anna Paquin as Marie D'Ancanto / Rogue. The story, villains, action scenes and powers usage are well-done, but Jean Grey and Storm could have done more with their powers, they are obviously depowered. The costumes, production design and music are good. The visual and special effects are mostly good, especially Wolverine, Magneto, Jean and Storm's powers. The interactions between the main X-Men characters, Professor X and Magneto, Magneto and Brotherhood of Mutants are well-done.

title: A beautifully made movie about friendship, romance, revenge and choices
review: Although the villains, main conflict and message are not as strong as the previous movies, this is still a recommended Sam Raimi's Spider-man movie.There are so many characters and plots in this movie. Love triangle with our best friend is hard, especially when both are our best friends. The presence and spirit of Uncle Ben is still emotionally preserved. The romance between Gwen Stacy and Eddie Brook is unnecessary.The good: Visual effects, production design, music, villains, action scenes, costumes, property; character development, motivation and actions; casting and performances of Tobey Maguire as Peter Parker/Spider-Man, Kirsten Dunst as Mary Jane Watson, James Franco as Harry Osborn/New Goblin, Thomas Haden Church as Flint Marko/Sandman, Topher Grace as Eddie Brock/Venom, Rosemary Harris as May Parker, J. K. Simmons as J. Jonah Jameson and the other characters.The bad: Some visual effects for Sandman.

title: What an adventure
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. Stunning animation and special effects, from the characters, properties, and landscapes.
2. A thrilling mystery full of cool action scenes.
3. Successful motion-capture technology adaptation.
4. The humorous Captain Archibald Haddock played by Andy Serkis is enjoyable.
5. Great lesson: persistence.
6. The story is interesting.Debatable holes:
1. The antagonists always missed the target when firing guns.
2. How possible could the opera singer destroy the bulletproof glass with her voice?
3. The chance of survival of Tintin, Snowy, and Captain Haddock on the ship, on the seaplane, on the lifeboat, on the dessert, and during chasing scene in Bagghar was tremendously high, with no injury.
4. Tintin's house was accidentally very close to the port, therefore Snowy was able to keep up.
5. When Red Rackham's ship was stuck with Sir Francis Haddock's, it was too heavy to swing above Haddock's ship.
6. When Sir Francis Haddock was trying to escape, no one was guarding. When he was setting the ship on fire and fighting Red Rackham, no one woke up.
7. How could Sir Francis Haddock survive after he destroyed Red Rackham's ship? How could he know the coordinate of the drown treasure?
8. Captain Haddock was fit and strong enough to hang onto something and hold his weight.
9. The destruction in Bagghar was massive, how could it be easily solved?
10. How could Tintin and Captain Haddock attend the The Milanese Nightingale? There should have been invitation and heavy guards. Captain Haddock and Tintin did not wear proper clothing. When Captain Haddock was making a mess, guards should have started securing him.
11. If the miniature model of the Unicorn was very valuable, how could it be sold in an outdoor market for just 1 pound? Could the seller not understand the value? How could it be there in the first place, because it was supposed to be given to a Haddock only?
12. How could no Haddock understand that there was secret message inside the model ship? How could Ivan Ivanovitch Sakharine know that? If there was no survivor from Red Rackham's side, how could the secret and story be passed down?

title: Fresh and interesting, with a surprising twist
review: Interesting story. The character development, character growth, and villains are well-done. MJ's character is a bit unnecessary and Tony Stark acts like a jerk. In Captain America: Civil War, he asked Peter to help him out without giving him enough explanation, then he just abandons him. This time, he asks him to stay out of superhero life. Then, after Peter defeats Vulture, Tony welcomes him to the Avengers. Peter could have died in Civil War, but Tony does not consider that.Great casting and good performances: Tom Holland as Peter Parker/Spider-Man and Michael Keaton as Adrian Toomes/Vulture are perfect.Good production set, props, costumes, music, visual effects, tone, action sequences.

title: An improvement of the first movie in almost all aspects
review:
The action scenes, visual effects, properties, music and costumes are better than the 1st movie. It is more enjoyable and solid. There are finally enemies who can fight hand-to-hand with Blade. Wesley Snipes as Blade and Kris Kristofferson as Abraham Whistler did great job. The other characters are interestingly cast, they did good job.Debatable holes:
1) Whistler too easily defeated Dieter Reinhardt and freed himself.
2) How could there be a secret connected tunnel that connected the place Whistler was held to Blade's? He easily found, figured it out, and used it.
3) How did Whistler shot Damaskinos's lawyer from the tunnel?
4) Whistler easily saved Blade without the enemies noticing.
5) How did Nomak find out about Damaskino's place?
6) What was Damaskino's plan? Did he think he could protect himself from Nomak using regular methods? Why did he foolishly kill his Bloodpack members? Did he not have other vampires to fight and protect? If so, why did he sacrifice the only fighters he had?
7) The lawyers' soldiers stupidly shot and attacked Nomak and Blade although they knew it would not affect them at all.
8) Blade's glasses was not broken.
9) Blade's endurance and strength were extraordinarily unlimited.
10) The enemies never killed Blade and Whistler every time they had the chance.
11) Whistler was an old-man with cancer. He was beaten to death but still had the power to survive, walk, and fight.

title: Well-made animated superhero movie
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The animation is fantastic.
2) The world-building and character design are awesome.
3) The character development, introduction and roles are perfect.
4) The storytelling and twists are great.
5) Great performances by Will Ferrell as Megamind, Tina Fey as Roxanne Ritchi, Jonah Hill as Hal Stewart, David Cross as Minion, and Brad Pitt as Metro Man.
6) A perfect movie for family and children.
7) Great lesson: treating others with respect.
8) The music is beautiful and the jokes are hilarious. The action and destruction scenes are awesome.This movie is great because we get the chance to see life from a point of view of a villain, how he could be a villain in the first place and how his live is compared to a hero.

title: Beautiful Christmas movie for family and children
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The visual effects are great, except for the humans and facial expressions.
2. The world building is beautiful and colorful: the train, nature, frozen lake, railway, north pole.
3. The voice cast is perfect, especially Tom Hanks who does perfect job for multiple characters.
4. The music and soundtrack are beautiful.
5. Great lessons: believe in something that is not visible (dreams, spirit, imagination).
6. The character development is great, for the hero boy, hero girl, lonely boy, and the know-it-all boy.
7. The audio effects are well done.Animations for humans and the facial expressions look unnatural.Debatable holes:
1. The way the flying ticket was blown against the wind, got stuck on a window, and formed a snowball felt not so real. It also should have had wrinkles after being eaten by a bird. But for the sake of magic, it worked.
2. The hero boy should have not survived when he was on the roof of the train. But for the sake of magic, it worked.
3. Why and how could the conductor and hero girl use the roof of the train to get to the front of the train?
4. There should have just been one person needed to fix the train lamp.
5. Did the lake get frozen every year?

title: A successful spy-superhero movie from Anthony and Joe Russo
review: The writing is fantastic. Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely do fantastic job of incorporating all elements. Captain America's past and present are well-bridged, especially his relationships with Peggy, Bucky, Zola, and the military; his friendships with Sam and Natasha, his trust issue with Fury, and his developing romance with Sharon. The character development and growth are nicely done. The villains are awesome, the Winter Soldier is extremely dangerous, and so do Alexander Pierce, Rumlow, Sitwell, and Hydra.The casting and performances are great. Chris Evans as Steve Rogers/Captain America, Scarlett Johansson as Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow, Sebastian Stan as Bucky Barnes/Winter Soldier, Anthony Mackie as Sam Wilson/Falcon, Cobie Smulders as Maria Hill, Frank Grillo as Brock Rumlow, Emily VanCamp as Sharon Carter, Robert Redford as Alexander Pierce, and Samuel L. Jackson as Nick Fury are perfect.The production set, props, costumes, and music are wonderful. The tone is perfect. The action sequences are terrific. The visual and special effects are magnificent.

title: Aesthetically beautiful masterpiece
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. One of movies with greatest visual effects ever. The beauty of ocean, nature, earth and life represented in one movie.
2. The story adaptation is successful and interesting from introduction, conflict and resolution.
3. Great lessons: stay hopeful, faithful, grateful, and resourceful.
4. Production design is outstandingly made.
5. The music accompanies every scene perfectly.
6. Suraj Sharma does great job.
7. A masterpiece from Ang Lee.

title: A visual achievement, an enlightening journey, a beautiful magic-based superhero movie
review: Jon Spaihts, Scott Derrickson, and C. Robert Cargill's writing and Scott Derrickson's directing are great. The character development, character growth, conflict, resolution, and villains are well-done.The casting and performances are great. Benedict Cumberbatch as Dr. Stephen Strange, Benedict Wong as Wong, and Tilda Swinton as the Ancient One are perfect. Chiwetel Ejiofor as Karl Mordo, Rachel McAdams as Christine Palmer, and Mads Mikkelsen as Kaecilius give great performances.The production set, props, costumes, cinematography, tone, editing, visual effects, special effects, and action sequences are great.

title: Quite enjoyable, but not big enough
review: It is quite funny and interesting. The writing is okay but quite messy. The villain is generic and his power is uninteresting.The casting and performances are good, especially Paul Rudd as Scott Lang/Ant-Man, Evangeline Lilly as Hope van Dyne, and Michael Douglas as Hank Pym. Corey Stoll as Darren Cross is good, but it is boring to see him become Yellowjacket.The visual effects are great. The costumes and action sequences are good.

title: Beautiful introduction to Captain America's mythos
review: It is well-written, successfully introduces the character, makes it relevant and lovable. The movie is reminiscent of 1990's Captain America movie, but the MCU version definitely has more depth and is perfectly tailored. The villains, character development, character growth, the friendship between Steve & Bucky and the romance between Steve & Peggy are well-done. Joe Johnston successfully does his job. Abraham Erskine's vision about and words to Steve Rogers are moving and beautiful.The casting and performances are splendid: Tommy Lee Jones as Chester Phillips, Hugo Weaving as Johann Schmidt/Red Skull, Hayley Atwell as Peggy Carter, Sebastian Stan as James Buchanan 'Bucky' Barnes, Dominic Cooper as Howard Stark, Neal McDonough as Timothy 'Dum Dum' Dugan, Stanley Tucci as Abraham Erskine, and Toby Jones as Arnim Zola. Chris Evans as Steve Rogers/Captain America is perfect, he has the physique and aura.The production set, costumes, props, music, make-up, and music are beautiful. The action scenes and visual effects are well-done, although skinny Steve Rogers' head is not proportional in some scenes.

title: I was surprised, awe-like
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The storytelling is wonderful. I thought it is only a movie about Hugo fixing the automaton. It is a beautiful retelling about history of film-making. It also contains brilliant references.
2. The visual effects are stunning.
3. The production design and properties are perfectly made for the movie.
4. The casting is splendid: Asa Butterfield as Hugo Cabret, Ben Kingsley as Georges Méliès, and Sacha Baron Cohen as Inspector Gustave Dasté. The other characters also do very good job.
5. The characters are well-developed and resolved.
6. The music is a perfect companion.
7. Great lessons: purpose & determination.
8. A true masterpiece from Martin Scorsese.

title: Jolie as a secret agent is amazing
review:
The story and twist are interesting. The casting is perfect. Great performances by Angelina Jolie as Evelyn Salt, iev Schreiber as Theodore Ted Winter, and Chiwetel Ejiofor as Peabody. The scene where Salt killed Winter is my favorite.Debatable holes:
1) Peabody and others should have been able to shoot Salt when they surrounded her before she jumped onto a truck.
2) Salt got into a hotel with guns. Did the hotel not have metal detectors?
3) How could Salt know the exact timing and location of the Russian president's speech? How could she know the underground way to the church?
4) The security around the church was weak, although they were American and Russian presidents.
5) How could nobody not see Salt when she got out of the police car?
6) The other Russian agents did not hear Salt killed her boss.
7) The other Russian agents were too easily killed and defeated by Salt.
8) How could they not detect the bomb brought in by Shnaider?
7) Salt very easily defeated all people who were protecting the US President. The security system was weak and easily breached.
8) How could the helicopters not able to find Salt after she jumped out of the helicopter? She could not hold her breath, stay underwater, and swim to the shore for that long. They could have just waited.

title: Interesting rip-off but not fun enough
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) Some jokes are funny.
2) The animation is great.
3) Good performances by Reese Witherspoon as Ginormica and Seth Rogen as B.O.B.Weaknesses of the movie:
1) The story is very bad, the plot is uninteresting.
2) The character development, introduction, motivation and roles are not done well.
3) The conflict and resolution are not interesting.
4) The aliens vs monsters aspect is not achieved.
5) Too many cliches, no unique elements.
6) The villain's design, character, motivation, and actions are not compelling.

title: Well-accomplished and beautiful Spider-man's origin story
review: Sam Raimi had a great power and a great responsibility, and he used it very wisely and he did it very well. I like the portrayal of the main characters. The character interactions are well-done. Uncle Ben and Aunt May are very lovely and their love to Peter is generously depicted. Uncle Ben's message is incredibly powerful: 'With great power, comes great responsibility'. The scene where Peter and Uncle Ben talk is really emotional.The great: Story, plot, production design, villains; character development, motivation and action; perfect casting and amazing performances from Tobey Maguire as Peter Parker/Spider-Man, Willem Dafoe as Norman Osborn/Green Goblin, Cliff Robertson as Ben Parker, Rosemary Harris as May Parker and J. K. Simmons as J. Jonah Jameson.The good: Casting and performances of the other characters, especially Kirsten Dunst as Mary Jane Watson and James Franco as Harry Osborn; Spider-man's costume is great, but Green Goblin's costume is unreasonable; the special effects are great, but some visual effects need improvement, like the explosion that kills Oscorp's board and when Green Goblin is flying with his glider; action scenes, property and worldbuilding.

title: A different world of Spider-man with the same core message, tragedy, conflict and development
review: This Spider-man is very much like a spider, from the way he crawls, uses the web and builds nest. Dr. Curt Connors' decisions to destroy things, kill people, infect the city, become a supervillain and suddenly help Peter from falling off the Oscorp building are not explained and developed very well. Uncle Ben's death is not as emotionally strong as Raimi's, but it is still beautifully depicted.The great: Amazing visual effects, production-design, action scenes, special effects, costumes, music; character development, motivation and actions.The good: Casting and performances of Andrew Garfield as Peter Parker/Spider-Man, Emma Stone as Gwen Stacy, Rhys Ifans as Dr. Curt Connors/The Lizard and the other characters.

movie_title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
title: The best movie from the Wizarding World franchise so far: Truly fantastic
review:
The visual effects, production design, properties, costumes, music, story, casting, acting, and actions scenes are absolutely fantastic. The creatures are not only gorgeous, but their relations to the main characters and uniqueness are well integrated. The leading roles are well-developed and introduced. The romance between Jacob and Queenie and the friendship between the four main characters are well-done. The world-building, magical spells and presentation between human and witch/wizard world are successfully depicted. The conflict, resolution, twists, and seeds for future movies are perfect. The tone, comedy, action, and warmth of the movie are successfully crafted by David Yates. Eddie Redmayne as Newt Scamander, Dan Fogler as Jacob Kowalski, Alison Sudol as Queenie Goldstein, and Colin Farrell as Percival Graves performed wonderfully. Katherine Waterston as Porpentina 'Tina' Goldstein, Carmen Ejogo as Seraphina Picquery, and the rest of the cast did good job.Debatable holes:
1) No one, not even the guards, were at the Central Park besides Newt and Jacob.
2) The erumpant did not encounter any human or witch/wizard during its outbreak.
3) Queenie easily saved Jacob from having his memory erased. They also easily took Newt's suitcase.
4) Only No-Majs who touched the rain had their memory erased. What about those who do not? What about digital proofs such as photograph, videos, and live reports on TV?

title: Fan-service for the novel lovers (maybe) & romance lovers
review:
I like the scene where the Cullens play baseball, the Cullens' house, the family bond of the Cullens. The music and costumes are good enough.Bella as a character is very stiff, awkward, and flat. Jacob's character is totally useless. All the characters are underdeveloped, including Bella, her friends, Charlie, the Cullens, the werewolves, the villains. Their backgrounds and motivations are not explored. The Cullens just run fast, pose, and push. The romance between Edward and Bella is forced, and it exists for the sake of the movie.Debatable holes:
1) The Cullens are obviously vampires. Common people should have figured it out from their appearance and habit.
2) The people should have been more familiar with vampires. If they could access the internet, books, or tales about vampires, then they were either brainwashed or never read about it.
3) Why Edward wanted Bella so much? What was so special about her? What had she done to Edward or the Cullens? What made her different?
4) Bella's friends were only presented at the beginning with so little background exploration.Bella's friends only introduced their names.Then, the situation was inverted. It was all about the Cullens and Bella's friends were gone. Bella did not even say hi to them when she went to school with Edward.
5) Why James wanted Bella so much that he would risk his life?
6) How did James know about Bella's old ballet studio?
7) Why should Edward suck the venom out of Bella, not Carlisle?
8) How did Carlisle know that Bella's blood was already clean? How did sucking blood would ensure that the venom was sucked out?
9) Bella did not find it disturbing that Edward stalked her.
10) Why could Edward not read Bella's mind?

title: The only significantly good things about the movie are destruction. disaster, and visual effects. I came, watched, and got them.
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The visual effects are outstandingly perfect.
2) The scientific references and reasoning in the movie are believable.
3) Beautiful music.
4) Awesome production design and properties.
5) Good performances by John Cusack as Jackson Curtis, Chiwetel Ejiofor as geologist Adrian Helmsley, Amanda Peet as Kate Curtis, Thandie Newton as Laura Wilson, Tom McCarthy as Gordon Silberman, Danny Glover as Thomas Wilson, Oliver Platt as Carl Anheuser, Woody Harrelson as Charlie Frost, and Zlatko Buric as Yuri Karpov.
6) Representation aspect is well-done.Weaknesses of the movie:
1) The scene where St. Peter's Basilica was falling looked odd.
2) Scenes where the characters just stand and look in awe at a coming disaster when they should actually do something or run away are very annoying.
3) Scenes where the characters spend too much time talking, especially Jackson & his daughter in Yellowstone, Jackson & his son and Jackson & her wife in the ark, are extremely ridiculous, although it is understandable that the movie-makers try to build emotional connection and relatability.

title: I came for the ride and I got it
review:
A man sells his soul to the Devil and works as his bounty hunter with a mission to defeat the Devil's son.Cool Ghost Rider adaptation with some awesome scenes and effects. It has problems with the villains and does not have enough action scenes. Nicolas Cage did good job, but he and the Ghost Rider are not well-translated.+ The good: Story, production design; Ghost Rider's costumes; Nicolas Cage as Johnny Blaze/Ghost Rider, Sam Elliott as Carter Slade/Caretaker, Eva Mendes as Roxanne Simpson, Wes Bentley as Blackheart/Legion, Donal Logue as Mack, Peter Fonda as Mephistopheles/The Devil, and Brett Cullen as Barton Blaze; supporting characters; most of the visual effects (destruction from the Ghost Rider, fire effects, chains and transportation); cool rides and music; the scene where the Ghost Rider rides with the Caretaker.
  • The bad: Visual effects for Johnny's skull and fire on the head, body of the thousand souls, the first time Johnny transforms into the Ghost Rider; the Hidden and Blackheart were easily defeated; lack of action scenes.

title: A nice ending to the X-Men trilogy
review: Great story and plot; the powers are mostly used and shown very well; casting and performances are great, especially Patrick Stewart as Charles Xavier/Professor X, Hugh Jackman as Logan/Wolverine, Ian McKellen as Erik Lehnsherr/Magneto, Halle Berry as Ororo Munroe/Storm, Famke Janssen as Dr. Jean Grey, James Marsden as Scott Summers/Cyclops, Rebecca Romijn-Stamos as Raven Darkhölme/Mystique, Shawn Ashmore as Bobby Drake/Iceman and Kelsey Grammer as Dr. Henry 'Hank' McCoy/Beast; good production design, visual & special effects (especially Magneto's power), props, music, costumes and make-up (especially Mystique and Beast). Cyclops and Professor X are killed without any significance, memorable scenes or cool power usage. It is nice to see various mutants and their unique powers. The final battle is good in terms of strategy, but the action scenes and power usage are very so-so.

movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales
title: Everything is rushed & too good to be true: characters, story, action scenes
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The visual effects are mesmerizing.
2) The production design, costumes, make-up and properties are wonderful.
3) I appreciate the performances of Johnny Depp as Captain Jack Sparrow, Javier Bardem as Captain Armando Salazar, Geoffrey Rush as Captain Hector Barbossa, and Kevin McNally as Joshamee Gibbs, although not as great as in previous movies.Weaknesses of the movie:
1) The story is not really interesting. The plot is weak, complicated, and coincidental.
2) The characters are not as interesting as in previous movies. Their introductions, development and roles are not done properly. Henry Turner and Carina Smyth are unnecessary additions, and the villains (Salazar, the Royal Navy) are not as compelling as before, in terms of story and portrayal.
3) The action scenes are boring.Debatable holes:
1) As always, the Royal Navy soldiers were ridiculously incompetent.
2) Why did the people accuse Carina as a witch? She did not do, look, or act anything bizarre. Although common people were ridiculously stupid, I could not understand their accusation. Not to mention the Royal Navy's hatred towards her.
3) In a world where magic, Kraken, ghosts, and curse existed, why did people in this movie (like the Royal navy crew and Carina) not believe in such?
4) The bank robbery was ridiculously not believable. The horses should have not been strong enough. The bank should have not been that mobile.
5) The execution of Carina and Jack could not be done properly.
6) How could Jack and his crew get away from the robbery? Why could the army not catch up?
7) Salazar could have just killed Jack easily when he could control water.
8) Why were Salazar and his men cursed? What did it have to do with the compass? How did Salazar know that it was the key to let them out of the zone?
9) How could Henry get away from the triangle zone?
10) How could Gibbs and the others get away from the British Navy ship?
11) How could Henry find Gibbs and the others to save Jack? Why would they even care? How could Henry find the money?
12) Why did Barbossa not let Carina to lead them in the first place? He, as captain, used starts to guide him.
13) Why were the people not familiar with astronomy? There was a shop with telescope.
14) Recurring characters did not seem like they aged.
15) It was too lucky that Henry, Carina and Jack could cross path, in terms of motivation, mutual goal, and relationship.
16) Carina could lead the way, but she did not have to steer.
17) If Salazar's army could not die (unless by standing on land) then how could anyone fight them? At least people who fought them got injured severely.
18) When Jack was forced to marry, how could the people be there? How could they had had experience with Jack?

title: Too many characters and the moviemakers cannot control/use them wisely.
review: An unnecessary apocalypse. I cannot believe that Days of Future Past and Apocalypse are directed by the same person. Great visual effects, music, production design, props, costumes and make-up. Very bad story, villains, conflict, motivation, actions. Disappointing action scenes. I like it when Quicksilver saves the X-Men from the explosion.Disappointment: Magneto's motivation to be villain. Apocalypse as the villain, his motivation and inability to use his powers or win. Angel's motivation. Psylocke motivation. Mystiques as a hero and an X-Men. Cyclops and Jean's romantic relationship. Xavier's inability to use his power. Storm's casting, acting, motivation. Nightcrawler's role, casting and appearance. Havok being killed. Moira, Jean, Cyclops, Beast, Stryker and Logan's roles. Xavier being naive about humans. Mutants cannot control their powers. Magnet's indecisiveness about his stance. X-Mansion easily destroyed and rebuilt. Xavier is powerless. Jean, Psylocke, Storm, Quicksilver, Magneto, Xavier and Apocalypse hold back. Apocalypse and Psylocke's powers are not clear. Jubilee as background character.

title: Visually stunning, but problematic villains
review: It is really fun too watch, especially with the beautiful colors, cool fights and many characters from Spider-man's world. Just enjoy and try not to be too serious. Unfortunately, we would never see the continuity of this universe. Peter's relationships with Gwen and Aunt May are well-portrayed. However, Max's character who turns into a supervillain, trying to kill everyone and destroy the city, is not clearly understandable. Max and Harry turn their own problem into a personal matter with Spider-man, which is not well-depicted and developed. Electro and Harry's characters and portrayal are not favorable.The great: Amazing visual effects, production-design, action scenes, special effects, costumes.The good: Music, character development; casting and performances of Andrew Garfield as Peter Parker/Spider-Man and Emma Stone as Gwen Stacy.The bad: The villains' motivations.

title: Bella and Edward's relationship is still the biggest mystery
review:
It is better than the first movie. Bella has more expressions and actions. The dynamics between her, Jacob and Edward is developed. It has better actions, conflict, and warmths. The music is perfect for the movie. Kristen Stewart as Bella Swan, Robert Pattinson as Edward Cullen, Taylor Lautner as Jacob Black, Ashley Greene as Alice Cullen, Billy Burke as Charlie Swan, Michael Sheen as Aro, and Dakota Fanning as Jane did good job. The visual effects and special effects are okay.The movie is too long with so many scenes where the characters just stare at something or Bella thinking/crying, or just pure silence and the camera moves around. The motivation of Edward for loving Bella is still not clearly developed, unlike the relationship between Jacob and Bella.Debatable holes:
1) How could Jacob save Bella on time when she jumped into the water? He was far away, how would he know about the location and that it was Bella?
2) Jacob did not know how to perform the chest compression. How could Bella be so lucky to survive? She was drowning for quite a while.
3) Why was no one look at Edward when he was revealing himself?

movie_title: Fantastic 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer
title: One of my favorite early superhero movies
review:
An alien called the Silver Surfer comes to earth to prepare the planet to be consumed by a planet-eating being, Galactus. The Fantastic 4 must cooperate with Doom to save the world from destruction, in which he himself has his own agenda.The teamwork of Fantastic 4 is fantastic. That is the best thing this movie has to offer. The design and appearance of Galactus is too bad: a powerless hungry giant cloud. The relationship between Ben and Alicia is more lovable than Reed and Sue's. It is nice to see Doom again, but it was not his full potential. His armor is cool, but he should have worn a green cape instead of black.+ The good: The Thing's make-up; The visual effects of Invisible Woman & Human Torch's powers, the Silver Surfer and his board, Galactus and the destructions; the production design, music, villain, action scenes; the teamwork, emotional and character development of the Fantastic 4; casting and performances of Ioan Gruffudd as Dr. Reed Richards/Mr. Fantastic, Jessica Alba as Susan Storm/Invisible Woman (at least better than the first movie), Chris Evans as Johnny Storm/Human Torch, Michael Chiklis as Ben Grimm/The Thing, Doug Jones and Laurence Fishburne as Norrin Radd/Silver Surfer, Julian McMahon as Victor von Doom/Doctor Doom, Kerry Washington as Alicia Masters, and Andre Braugher as General Hager.
  • The bad: The visual effects of Mr. Fantastic's stretchy power and the FantastiCar; the costumes of the Fantastic 4 and Doom are not improved; more action scenes are highly expected.

movie_title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
title: Emotional, funny, & fun consumption for family and children
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The concept is very interesting, the story is not bad.
2) The animation is very great, the colors and world-building are fantastic.
3) Hilarious jokes and cartoonish characters make it enjoyable.
4) Good performances by Bill Hader as Flint Lockwood, Anna Faris as Sam Sparks, James Caan as Tim Lockwood, Bruce Campbell as Mayor Shelbourne, Andy Samberg as 'Baby' Brent McHale, Mr. T as Officer Earl Devereaux, Bobb'e J. Thompson as Calvin 'Cal' Devereaux, and Benjamin Bratt as Manny.
5) Great lessons: acknowledgement, greediness, and responsibility.

title: There is no other person than James Gunn who could achieve this success
review: James Gunn and Nicole Perlman wrote the movie very brilliantly. The character development, character growth, villains, and humor are well-done.The casting and performances are great: Chris Pratt as Peter Quill/Star-Lord, Zoe Saldana as Gamora, Dave Bautista as Drax the Destroyer, Bradley Cooper as Rocket, Lee Pace as Ronan the Accuser, Michael Rooker as Yondu Udonta, Karen Gillan as Nebula, Djimon Hounsou as Korath, John C. Reilly as Rhomann Dey, Glenn Close as Irani Rael, and Benicio del Toro as Taneleer Tivan/The Collector.The production set, props, costumes, make-up, score, songs, visual and special effects, tone, cinematography, and action sequences are fantastic.

title: The movie has 'death' aura which makes it not very interesting.
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) The battle scenes where Perseus fights Medusa and when he fights the Kraken are amazing.
2) The score is beautiful.Weaknesses of the movie:
1) The visual effects are terrible.
2) The acting is very disappointing.
3) The first half of the movie is very boring and the story is not appealing.
4) Most of the characters are annoying, except Io and Draco, the captain.
5) The characters' motivation, introduction, action and development are not well done.
6) The shining armors of the gods of Olympus are very annoying and look cheap.
7) The gods do not look like gods, casting-wise, acting-wise, costumes and make-up, powers, decisions and actions.Debatable holes:
1) If Danae was dead, how could baby Perseus be born?
2) It only took minutes/hours for Danae to be pregnant.
3) How was Perseus born?
4) How did Perseus return from the underworld?
5) Why did Draco not bring Zeus' sword to the underworld with him?
6) How could Zeus not know that Perseus was alive all this time? How could he not know that he has a son?
7) Why did only the Djinn leader help Perseus to go to the underworld?
8) When Hades had Medusa's had, he could have just gone to the underworld, where Perseus cannot follow.
9) After Perseus saved Andromeda, how could they be on a beach?
10) How could Perseus' feelings and stance towards Zeus suddenly change after the final battle?

title: Deep messages, hilarious & performances
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. Great lessons: parenting, family, and sins.
2. Amazing performance by Freddie Highmore as Charlie Bucket.
3. The production design of Wonka's chocolate factory is gorgeous.
4. The music by Danny Elfman is fantastic.
5. The costumes are colorful and lovely.
6. Johny Depp's performance as Willy Wonka is unique, although not really pleasant. Deep Roy is hilarious as Oompa Loompas. The choreography is interesting.The visual effects are not smooth, although visually interesting. Representation is also weak, because the children and parents are white and either from Europe or America.Debatable holes:
1. There was no explanation about how and why Wilbur's house was moved (in just 1 day).
2. Physics did not apply in the elevator.
3. It was very coincidental that Charlie lived very near the chocolate factory. Otherwise he would not be able to attend.
4. The golden ticket was only sent to Europe and America.

title: As an Avengers-level movie, this is disappointing, especially from a director who created 2012's the Avengers. Just throw many superheros, villains, explosions, and destructio
review: It is quite complicated and hard to follow. For a comic-book superhero movie, the overall story is good, but some parts especially in the first half of the movie do not click so well. Tony's motivation, decision, and reasoning to create Ultron are terribly disappointing, he exactly sounds like a super-villain, just like Ultron in the movie. It is too bad that Tony's character is treated that way, because he is supposed to be wiser. Ultron as a villain is interesting in his own way, but it feels like the character, his motivation, powers, and existence are vague. How he could be created, what he wants to achieve, what he is capable of, how he could be defeated, and how he could think, talk, and act the way he does are confusing. The villains are too many. Using Baron Wolfgang von Strucker, Dr. List, the rest of Hydra, Ulysses Klaue, Quicksilver and Scarlet Witch as the only villains, in which the last two would then turn heroes, would be much preferred and more relatable. This movie does pick up where Captain America: the Winter Soldier left off, but the time-skip makes it not connected very well.The casting and performances are well-done: Robert Downey Jr. as Tony Stark/Iron Man (although Tony's character is very cringe in the first half), Chris Hemsworth as Thor, Mark Ruffalo as Bruce Banner/Hulk, Chris Evans as Steve Rogers/Captain America, Scarlett Johansson as Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow, Jeremy Renner as Clint Barton/Hawkeye, Don Cheadle as James 'Rhodey' Rhodes/War Machine, Elizabeth Olsen as Wanda Maximoff/Scarlet Witch, Paul Bettany as J.A.R.V.I.S. and Vision, Cobie Smulders as Maria Hill, Anthony Mackie as Sam Wilson/Falcon, Stellan Skarsgård as Erik Selvig, James Spader as Ultron, Samuel L. Jackson as Nick Fury, Claudia Kim as Helen Cho, and Andy Serkis as Ulysses Klaue. Aaron Taylor-Johnson as Pietro Maximoff/Quicksilver is okay, but his character is cringe, his power is not impressively depicted, and he dies so disappointingly for stupid reason. Why did they kill this character?The production set, costumes, props, practical effects and make-up are beautiful; the cinematography is well-done, the shots in which the superheroes are in one frame are so cool; the score is beautiful; the action sequences are well-done, especially the opening sequence.

movie_title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
title: More emotionally-developed, more risk, more actions
review:
The costumes, properties and production design are great. Daniel Radcliffe as Harry Potter, Rupert Grint as Ron Weasley, Emma Watson as Hermione Granger, Helena Bonham Carter as Bellatrix Lestrange, Ralph Fiennes as Lord Voldemort, Michael Gambon as Albus Dumbledore and the rest of the cast did good job. Imelda Staunton as Dolores Umbridge is a great addition to the movie, the character successfully makes me hate her. This is the most emotional movie so far, especially between Harry and Sirius, his parents, Voldemort, and his friends.The visual effects need improvement. During fighting scenes, the villains look like they are holding back.Debatable holes:
1) How did they know that Harry used magic in front of his cousin? If they could find out, how about Hagrid in the first movie, the flying car in the second movie, or when Harry inflated Aunt Marge Dursley?
2) Hogwarts students sometimes hate Harry, love Harry, trust Harry, call him liar, bully him, or adore him according to the plot.
3) Could they use some kind of magic or potion or plant or object to see Harry's past in order to prove him that he was totally innocent of using magic in front of his cousin? They could use truth serum.
4) Could the prophecy be used to predict Voldemort's arrival?
5) If the students could not even perform expelliarmus, stupefy, or any basic charms, what did they learn then? Even the Weasley twins could not do anything or serve as a teacher for Dumbledore's army.
6) If Voldemort-level threat was coming, why did senior students of Hogwarts not do something?
7) Harry had more experiences in heroism, but his magical skills was almost at the same level as other students.
8) How could Harry and friends get to London so easily and fast? They even got into the Department of Mysteries very easily without anyone noticing.
9) How did Bellatrix know about Nevile?
10) The Death Eaters could not defeat nor harm the children.
11) Lucius could have easily taken the prophecy from Harry.
12) Why was only Bellatrix perform a dangerous charm?
13) Bellatrix or any other Death Eaters could have easily defeated or killed more protagonists.
14) Bellatrix teleported without using any Floo Powder or mentioning the destination.
15) Lupin let harry chase Bellatrix by himself.
16) Harry was (and friends were) luckily saved just in time, as always.
17) What took the Aurors so long?
18) Why did the Dementors attack Harry and his cousin?
19) Why did Harry and friends go to the Department of Mysteries, not the place of the order?
20) Fudge must be punished severely, because he was the cause of Sirius' death.
21) Why was Lucius not sent to Azkaban? He was seen at the graveyard by Harry in the previous movie.

movie_title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
title: I was eager for the final battle, because everything else was so so. But then, the final battle was not as expected.
review:
The music, score, tone, opening and end credit sequences, and casting are perfect for the movie.The visual effects are okay, but Bella's first hunt scene does not look smooth. The action scenes are not as expected, the Volturi holds back. Most of the conflicts are unnecessary and underdeveloped, because they are only caused by misunderstanding or lack of self-control. The vampires gathering and Volturi's visit are just for the sake of the movie, because it could easily be solved through a fair trial or discussion. The final resolution was weak, because the Volturi just leaves, although they bring huge army. Since the final battle is only Alice's alternate vision, it undercuts the risk that the movie offers. The imprint is interesting but is not sufficient to solve the conflicts. The emotion of almost all characters in the movie is very unstable.Debatable holes:
1) Why did the Volturi have to wait for few days to come to the Cullens?
2) Baby Renesmee did not have vampire features, like eyes, fangs, skin and body temperature, or constant physical need for blood.
3) How could Bella hold herself when Charlie came to the Cullen's? Baby Renesmee also did nothing when she was on Jacob's arms or near humans.
4) For convenience, the Cullens easily have the wealth and easy access to airplane ticket and housing furniture.
5) If the Volturi was some kind of government for the vampires, why did they not have system for crime reporting, fair trial, discussion, proof gathering and validation, and trustworthy members? The members only acted based on their instinct and emotion.
6) How could Jacob know that the 'uninvited' vampires were uninvited? What about the Amazonian ones?
7) Bella ridiculously easily control her desire for human blood.
8) Edward could have easily read Alice's mind.
9) How could the vampires control themselves when Jacob was in the house? How could the 'food' be sustainable and enough for all?
10) How did all vampires know about Carlisle's intention to gather witnesses? Did he called them? Why did they need to travel, then?
11) How could Bella have the defensive power when she was in human form? Could humans have powers as well? How could the power be so random and extensively powerful, like controlling elements?
12) Why was Bella so special that her power was always active even when no one realized it and she did not know about it?
13) Alice's vision could change, but it never happened. It was too convenient for the Cullens.
14) How far could Alice see the future? What were the constraints? Did she always have to watch the one she was trying to sense? How many people could she sense at the same time? Did they have to be in certain range?
15) When Carlisle's vampire friends and family went back, the Volturi could just attack the Cullens easily.
16) What did the Volturi want exactly? What were their job and responsibilities as 'Volturi'?
17) In the battle, the Volturi could defeat the Cullens and friends very easily. Jane's pain ability could be very effective.
18) Sometimes, a vampire could easily break another vampire's head/limbs easily, but sometimes, it is not the case.
19) Why was immortal child so dangerous? Why could the vampires not able to restraint/train it? What made a regular vampire child and an immortal child different?
20) Why would Irina not tell her assumption about immortal child to her family first? Why did she not ask for explanation first?
21) Why did anyone think that Renesmee could pose a threat?
22) Why did Alice and Jasper have to go secretly?

title: Awesome mystery-adventure-action movie
review:
Great things about the movies:
1) The story, mystery/clue solving and action scenes are great.
2) The casting is perfect .
3) Great performances by Nicolas Cage as Benjamin Franklin Gates, Sean Bean as Ian Howe, Diane Kruger as Dr. Abigail Chase, Justin Bartha as Riley Poole, Jon Voight as Patrick Henry Gates, and Harvey Keitel as Agent Peter Sadusky.
4) The production design and properties are beautiful.
5) The score is fantastic.
6) The character introduction, roles, and development are great. The dynamics of protagonist vs antagonist are perfect.
7) The visual effects are well done.Debatable holes:
1) The password for the preservation room was extremely weak.
2) The security system during gala dinner was very weak.
3) The gift shop clerk thought that Ben took a souvenir copy, which he did not. It was either Ben intended to take a souvenir copy in the first place or the clerk did not scan the souvenir copy bar-code.
4) The enemies always failed to hit their targets.
5) Why did Ian decide to go to Boston alone without taking Ben? He barely got enough clue.

title: Visually mesmerizing, from the first second to the last
review: James Gunn successfully repeats hi success with the Guardians of the Galaxy. Great writing. The character development, character growth, villains, and humor are well-done.The casting and performances are great: Chris Pratt as Peter Quill/Star-Lord, Zoe Saldana as Gamora, Dave Bautista as Drax the Destroyer, Bradley Cooper as Rocket, Michael Rooker as Yondu Udonta, Karen Gillan as Nebula, Pom Klementieff as Mantis, Elizabeth Debicki as Ayesha, and Kurt Russell as Ego.The production set, props, costumes, make-up, score, songs, visual and special effects, tone, cinematography, and action sequences are fantastic. Beautiful worldbuilding.

title: Multiple layers of villains, interesting & controversial mystery and exploration
review:
Great things about the movie:
1) Amazing storytelling and adaptaion of the brilliant novel by Dan Brow.
2) Great performances by Ian McKellen as Sir Leigh Teabing, Alfred Molina as Bishop Aringarosa, Jean Reno as Police Captain Bezu Fache, Paul Bettany as Silas, Jürgen Prochnow as André Vernet, Tom Hanks as Robert Langdon and Audrey Tautou as Sophie Neveu.
3) The production design and music are perfect.
4) The character introductions and roles are well done.
5) The mysteries, clues, and references are very interesting.

title: Technical accomplishment, beautiful performance
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The production design is outstanding. It successfully makes the viewers feel that they are part of Titanic.
2. The visual effects are great, especially the technical aspects of Titanic.
3. The story is simple yet beautiful.
4. The casting and acting are successful. Leonardo DiCaprio as Jack Dawson, Kate Winslet as Rose DeWitt Bukater, and Billy Zane as Cal Hockley all give amazing performances. The supporting characters also do good job.
5. The character development and roles in the movie are well-done. Each character contributes to the movie and overall story.
6. 'My Heart Will Go On' by Céline Dion is phenomenal.
7. A masterpiece from James Cameron.The visual effects for some scenes are not completely perfect. I can see that it is just green screen, like when Jack and Rose are at the bow.

movie_title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
title: Magical movie, very entertaining for family and children
review:
The music, casting, character interaction, tone, properties, costumes, production design, and world-building are perfect. Great performances by Daniel Radcliffe as Harry Potter, Rupert Grint as Ron Weasley, Emma Watson as Hermione Granger, Robbie Coltrane as Rubeus Hagrid, Richard Harris as Albus Dumbledore, Alan Rickman as Severus Snape, Maggie Smith as Minerva McGonagall, and Tom Felton as Draco Malfoy did great job.The visual and special effects need improvement, although some are gorgeous. The final conflict, final resolution, and actions taken or not taken by Hogwarts teachers are weak.Debatable holes:
1) Harry and friends found the troll long before the teachers did.
2) Why was Gryffindor's seeker position vacant? Did they not have a senior student for it?
3) Harry and friend's detention was at Hagrid's? It was too convenient for Harry.
4) The students were asked to go to the Forbidden Forest, although they were strictly forbidden to do so.
5) Hagrid left Harry and Draco alone in the forest.
6) During Quidditch game, Hermione got to the other side so quickly and unnoticeable.
7) What made Harry so special to be a seeker?
8) Hagrid was conveniently too easy to spill things out from his mouth. How could he be trusted by the teachers?
9) Why where there a broom in the room of flying keys?
10) Why could the flying keys not be able to attack Harry and friends?
11) Harry easily spotted the key to open the door.
12) Harry easily got the key to open the door.
13) How proficient was the magical chess? It was easily defeated by children.
14) Professor Quirrell could not even defeat Harry. He could have easily killed Harry with a spell.
15) How could Professor Quirrell easily get into the final room? Did he set the trap?
16) If Professor Quirelle had been in the final room before Harry and friends arrived, how could the key still be outside the chess room?
17) The House Cup point system was subjective. There was no system that regulates how a point is taken or given, by who, and for what actions.
18) If Professor Quirrell's action could lead to extreme danger (Voldemort got free), how could the teachers not do anything about it?

title: Interesting introduction to Thor's mythos
review: The writing is okay, but the characters are too many. The Warriors Three and Darcy Lewis could have been written out. Volstagg, Hogun, and Fandral do not do much, their powers and skills are inferior to most known characters in the MCU so far, and their relationships with Thor are not so close. Darcy Lewis does not do much as well, her contribution to Jane's project or for Thor's problem is not significant and her relationships with any other characters are not explored. The root cause of Asgardians and Frost Giants' conflict should have been explored more, along with the latter's background and intentions, because they are only introduced as the bad guys. The character development and character growth are well-done for Thor, Loki, and Odin. Thor is completely arrogant and annoying at first and this movie explores his growth to be humble and selfless. In the end, Loki's motivations and actions are very understandable for what he has been through. Thor and Loki are the only ones who maximize their powers, especially the latter's mischievousness. The Frost Giants are definitely depowered.Some casting are good, some are so so. Chris Hemsworth as Thor, Tom Hiddleston as Loki, Stellan Skarsgård as Erik Selvig, Anthony Hopkins as Odin, Jaimie Alexander as Sif, and Clark Gregg as Phil Coulson are well-cast and their performances are good, especially Anthony Hopkins. Thor's banishment scene is very cool. Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston, and Idris Elba as Heimdall are good, but they would shine much more in the future movies. Casting Natalie Portman as Jane Foster is okay, but her performance is not compelling in some scenes, because she acts like a fan-girl of Thor.The production design (Asgard, the Mjolnir site, and Jotunheim), costumes, props, and music are beautiful. Most action scenes are disappointing (SHIELD agents, the Warriors Three, Frost Giants, battle with Destroyer, the final battle with Loki). Some visual effects are gorgeous (like the colorful skies, Bifröst, Asgard), but some look fake, like the Destroyer. The sound editing is not smooth and accurate enough. The bright tone is good, but it is uncomfortable when the scene suddenly changes to night time. The Frost Giants' make-up and effects look good.

movie_title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
title: The movie is too long, and the complicated story is not really convincing
review:
It is a great story for a novel, but for the movie, it is a bit complicated, which caused the movie to be so long. The cast did okay job. The flying car and ghost effects, costumes, production designs, and properties are well-done.The visual effects for Dobby and basilisk among others need improvements. Hermione as the only student who knows everything is too much. Harry and friends do all the work, no senior students, teachers or staff did anything to help or could figure it out at all. The main characters are always so lucky and everything always happens at the right time and at the right moment for the sake of the plot.Debatable holes:
1) When using the Floo powder, what would happen if there are two places with the same name? If there are multiple fireplaces at the destination, which one will be used?
2) Hagrid found Harry at Knockturn Alley at the exact moment he needed help.
3) How would someone know that there is someone at the other side of Platform Nine and Three-Quarters?
4) How could Ron have the car key?
5) How could Harry and Ron arrive at Hogwarts using the flying car? Is it connected to London King's Cross railway station?
6) How could Dobby put a spell at Platform Nine and Three-Quarters just in time? Was he around there at that time? How could he catch up?
7) When a teacher gives a house points, who writes it down? How does the teacher know about the student's house? Do they remember every student?
8) If a student could get point just by simply answering a question, then it should apply to all actions taken by the students.
9) How could Gilderoy Lockhart the new teacher know the students' name?
10) If the professor could easily lose his wand from Cornish Pixies, how could he become a teacher in the first place? Hogwarts as the best magical school should be questioned.
11) Why were all classes at Hogwarts so dangerous and destructive? Did they not have teaching methodology, system, and curriculum?
12) Why did all students except Harry, Hermione, Ron and Nevile, left the class when the Cornish Pixies were causing trouble?
13) When Harry and friends found Argus Filch's cat, why did Argus, and then the students, and then Dumbledore and other teachers come together just in time?
14) For this movie, only teachers relevant for the movie showed up, just like in the first movie. Except during dinner, of course.
15) It is unfair for heads of houses to be able to give or take points.
16) Audiences and players could die from playing Quidditch.
17) They should have stopped the Quidditch game when the ball was out of control. They did not do anything when it destroyed the stadium. They did not even do anything when it almost killed Harry.
18) Dobby almost killed Harry few times.
19) How could they blame Harry Potter just because he was at the crime scene? Hogwarts is an educational institution, not a drama club.
20) What is required to cast a spell, exactly? Does someone should think about the spell in its mind? Say it out loud? Sustain eye-contact with the object? Need a wand or just hand wave? How could magical object be sentient? How could magical spell be active all the time without eye-contact from the one who makes it? How is someone chosen to be able to perform magic?
21) What does being a member of a house actually mean? Does it teach or give something to its members? If a certain house is bad or good, why is the system still applied? No other houses have been highlighted so far except Gryffindor and Slytherin
22) How could Crabbe and Goyle be stupid enough to eat a flying cake? If it was flying, then of course it was spelled. They should have known it, except those 2 characters were more stupid than Dobby.
23) How did Harry and Ron know that Crabbe and Goyle, and only the two of them, would come out of the room, see and eat the cake without thinking with no witnesses? How did they hide the bodies?
24) Hermione did not lock the bathroom door when she was turning into a cat.
25) Hagrid suddenly found Harry and friends when they were talking about him.
26) Dumbledore and Fudge came just in time before Harry and Ron. They did not see them at all. What made the problem so important that the minister himself have to come to Hagrid's house without assistance?
27) When Harry and Ron came out from Hagrid's house, no one saw them.
28) Why did recovering the petrified students take so long?
29) If the problem could cause someone to die, or even cause Hogwarts to shut down, why did the teachers not form an investigation committee and do something? The senior students could have done something too.
