30) How could Gilderoy Lockhart be a Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher? Was he not tested and selected?
31) How could Harry easily open the paths to the Chamber of Secrets? How did he know about what to say? Could someone with no ability to speak to snakes open the chamber?
32) Before Harry, Ron, and Lockhart entered the chamber, they should have called the teachers. No one even realized that they found the chamber.
33) The cave-in surprisingly separated Harry and Ron, with Harry on the side leading to the chamber.
34) How could a memory have a body and be tangible?
35) How could Tom manipulate Ginny?
36) If Tom was just a memory, how could he know about recent events?
37) How could Fawkes come just in time to save Harry? How did it know the location?
38) The basilisk should have easily caught or defeated Harry.
39) A piercing sword should have not easily killed the basilisk.
40) Could Tom perform a magic spell? He could write his name using the wand.
41) What proof did they have that Hagrid was sent to Azkaban?
42) Once again, Hogwarts, the best magical school could not even stop another Voldemort-level threat, but 3 young students could. In fact, the teachers were in their way and people were accusing them of terrible acts.
43) What was Tom's intention after realizing the basilisk?
44) Lucius should have been sent to Azkaban instead, because he was the real culprit. There were witnesses that he put the diary at Ginny's basket: Harry, Hermione, and the Weasleys.
45) How could the basilisk survive for so long? What did it eat? The chamber's exit was not only the entry way.
46) How did Dobby know that Harry was in danger?
47) What danger could possibly harm Harry, as mentioned by Dobby?

title: The humor and message win my heart
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The story is excellent.
2. The animation is well-done, the characters ideas and designs are wonderful.
3. The voice cast is perfect, especially Johnny Depp as Rango, Isla Fisher as Beans, Ned Beatty as Tortoise John, and Bill Nighy as Rattlesnake Jake.
4. Great lessons: local people vs new businesses, heroism & true self,trust, promise and hope.
5. The jokes are very funny and Rango is very hilarious.Debatable holes:
1. The bullets from the moles clan did not hit any of the good guys.
2. After the posse got out of the underground, they had some rides. Where did the rides come from?

title: Beautiful prequel and X-Men's origin story
review: Good story, plot and villains' great visual and special effects; good production design, action scenes, powers usage, costumes, make-up, music, character and emotional development; Magneto's costume at the end of the movie looks weird and does not fit with his character; great casting and performances, especially James McAvoy as Charles Xavier/Professor X and Michael Fassbender as Erik Lehnsherr/Magneto. Good casting and performances, especially Rose Byrne as Moira MacTaggert, January Jones as Emma Frost, Kevin Bacon as Sebastian Shaw, Jason Flemyng as Azazel and Nicholas Hoult as Hank McCoy / Beast. Jennifer Lawrence is okay as Raven Darkhölme/Mystique, but she does not have Mystique's aura and her character is different from how she should be. The relationship between Charles and Erik is well done. It is nice to see Hugh Jackman and Rebecca Romijn's cameos.

title: Less mutants but enough action
review: Good story, plot and villains; great visual effects; good production design, costumes, props, music, action scenes, character and emotional development; good casting and performances, especially Hugh Jackman as Logan/Wolverine, Hiroyuki Sanada as Shingen Yashida, Tao Okamoto as Mariko Yashida, Rila Fukushima as Yukio, Famke Janssen as Jean Grey, Will Yun Lee as Kenuichio Harada, Svetlana Khodchenkova as Dr. Green/Viper, Haruhiko Yamanouchi as Ichiro Yashida/Silver Samurai and Brian Tee as Noburo Mori.

title: Emotional and hilarious
review:
Great things about the movie:
1. The story is great and inspiring.
2. Amazing performances by Jim Carrey as Bruce Nolan, Morgan Freeman as God, Jennifer Aniston as Grace Connelly, and Steve Carell as Evan Baxter.
3. The visual and special effects are well done.
4. Great lessons about being a miracle for others.Debatable holes:
1. Bruce's live report at Niagara and Evan's embarrassing on-air session should have been cut from TV.
2. Bruce should have suffered from more injuries after the truck incident.

title: Many interesting mutants are introduced through strong story and cool fights
review: Great story and plot; the powers are used and shown very well; casting and performances are great, especially Patrick Stewart as Charles Xavier/Professor X, Hugh Jackman as Logan/Wolverine, Ian McKellen as Erik Lehnsherr/Magneto, Halle Berry as Ororo Munroe/Storm, Famke Janssen as Dr. Jean Grey, James Marsden as Scott Summers/Cyclops, Rebecca Romijn-Stamos as Raven Darkhölme/Mystique, Brian Cox as Colonel William Stryker, Alan Cumming as Kurt Wagner/Nightcrawler, Anna Paquin as Marie/Rogue, Shawn Ashmore as Bobby Drake/Iceman, Aaron Stanford as John Allerdyce/Pyro and Kelly Hu as Yuriko Oyama/Deathstrike; good production design, visual & special effects (Nightcrawler, adamantium claws, Professor X freezes everyone in time), props, music, costumes and make-up (Nightcrawler and Mystique). Cyclops is still depowered and does not do anything significant. Jean Grey uses her power very well only at the end of the movie. Jean's decision to sacrifice herself is very questionable and irrational, it is done so only for future movie plot. Mystique's plan to release Magneto, Magneto's escape scene, Wolverine vs Deathclaw, Nightcrawler teleportation scenes and Storm's tornadoes scene are all so cool.

title: It needs more Asgard and cosmic stuff, less Jane and earthly things
review: The writing is okay. It is nice to see the developing relationship between Thor and Loki, the Warriors Three, and Lady Sif. The Warriors Three and Lady Sif's roles are well-done, unlike in the first movie. Jane, Erik, Darcy, and Ian's involvements are unnecessary. The villains, the Dark Elves, are generic and uninteresting. Loki's mischievousness is once again well-portrayed. The culture of and everything in Asgard are so beautiful, the movie should have focused on Asgard and other beautiful realms (but not dark and lifeless ones) instead of earth.The casting and performances are good: Chris Hemsworth as Thor, Tom Hiddleston as Loki, Anthony Hopkins as Odin, Stellan Skarsgård as Erik Selvig, Idris Elba as Heimdall, Christopher Eccleston as Malekith, Natalie Portman as Jane Foster, Kat Dennings as Darcy Lewis, Ray Stevenson as Volstagg, Zachary Levi as Fandral, Jaimie Alexander as Sif, and Rene Russo as Frigga.The production set, costumes, music, visual and special effects, make-up and props are beautiful. The tone is sometimes too dark, sometimes too yellow.

title: Entertaining action-packed R-rated superhero movie
review: Good writing, characters, tone, production set, score, music. Great visual and special effects, action scenes, comedy, 4th wall breaking, lines and pop culture references, costumes, prop, make-up, comic adaptation. Perfect casting. Ajax, Angel and Negasonic' motivations are not deep enough.

title: It is fun to watch this incarnation of the Fantastic Four and Doctor Doom
review:
5 people go to space for a science project and have their genes mutated due to a disaster that grants them superpowers. Some try to fix the new normal while some use the opportunity to gain advantage. Doom uses his power for evil intentions and it is up to the other 4 to stop him.If Fantastic Four mythos was science that kids should learn, this movie is the elementary school. The plot where they fight Doctor Doom comes a bit late. The movie focuses too much on Reed and Sue's relationship, Johnny's fame, and Ben with his unsure acceptance of his appearance. Reed is a thinker, but not a genius-level intellect. Victor is dangerous, but not Dr. Doom level-dangerous. The movie should have shown more effective and interesting usage of the superpowers.+ The good: The Thing's make-up; Invisible Woman & Human Torch's visual effects; the production design, music, villain, costumes; okay action scenes; the relationships and interactions of the Fantastic 4; character development and motivation; casting and performances of Ioan Gruffudd as Dr. Reed Richards/Mr. Fantastic, Chris Evans as Johnny Storm/Human Torch, Michael Chiklis as Ben Grimm/The Thing, and Julian McMahon as Victor von Doom/Doctor Doom.
  • The bad: Mr. Fantastic's visual effects.

title: Only the final battle scene that is satisfying
review: It is an improvement over the previous movies. The love triangle and characters' background are explored deeper. The visual effects and special effects are okay. The music is perfect for the movie. It has better and cooler action scenes. The final fight is my favorite scene of the movie. Kristen Stewart as Bella Swan, Robert Pattinson as Edward Cullen, Taylor Lautner as Jacob Black, Peter Facinelli as Carlisle Cullen, Ashley Greene as Alice Cullen, Nikki Reed as Rosalie Hale, and Jackson Rathbone as Jasper Hale, and Anna Kendrick as Jessica Stanley did good job.The relationship between Edward and Bella escalates is still not well-built due to lack of strong foundation, unlike Bella and Jacob. The antagonists' motivation is very shallow, no tangible risk, and everything is on the protagonists' side.

title: It delivers unexpected important powerful message about life of penguins
review: The visual effects are outstanding, the world-building and animals are gorgeous. The music and musical scenes are beautiful. Great performances by Elijah Wood as Mumble, E.G. Daily as baby Mumble, Robin Williams as RamÃ³n, Cletus, Lovelace, and the narrator, Brittany Murphy as Gloria, Hugh Jackman as Memphis, Nicole Kidman as Norma Jean, and Hugo Weaving as Noah the Elder.I really like and appreciate the messages of the movie about irresponsible over-fishing and taking penguins for tourism attraction. The scenes where Mumble was chasing the ship and when he was in the glasses room are very emotional, powerful, and my favorites. There are two aspects of the movie that are very different: the musical and dramatic aspects of the movie that are friendly for family and kids; and the criticism for human's involvement that affects penguin's life. I wish they explored the latter more and exposed more aspects about human role.

title: If you watch for the war scenes, character designs, and visual effects, you will be satisfied
review: The world-building, properties, costumes, character designs, action scenes, and magical spells scenes are great. Casting and acting are good enough for the movie. The story is quite interesting, but hard to follow at the beginning. There are so many characters in the movie, that is why they are not well-explored and the movie is very long.In some scenes, the visual effects need improvement, especially for the golem and griffin. The orcs look so slow when fighting, therefore they could be defeated by the humans.
